intro: Gilibertia paniculata, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Gilibertia paniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
